intro: Karomia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star tree, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed surrounded by a fleshy, aromatic pulp. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a rare and valuable species in its native habitat.
